intro: Bidens tenera, commonly known as the common ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open fields and along roadsides, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Bidens tenera is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
